intro: Conocephalus sengalensis, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, kidney-shaped berries. Its roots and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Conocephalus sengalensis make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
